snippet: Federal data of youths found that though more have reported using the devices, it does not appear that they have acted as bridges to traditional cigarettes.
abstract: Data from Centers for Disease Control and Prevention shows e-cigarette use is still increasing among young teenagers and preteens but cigarette smoking rates have not increased, momentarily alleviating fears that e-cigarettes would lead to increase in use of traditional cigarettes among American youth.
lead_paragraph: Federal data of youths found that though more have reported using the devices, it does not appear that they have acted as bridges to traditional cigarettes.

headline.main: E-Cigarette Use by U.S. Teenagers Rose Last Year, Report Says
headline.print_headline: E-Cigarettes Aren’t Getting Youths Hooked on Tobacco, Study Suggests

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
